intro: Spergularia echinosperma subsp. albensis, commonly known as the white sand spurry, is a flowering plant native to sandy soils in southern Europe. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as dunes and coastal areas. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. It is often found in association with other pioneer species in sandy and arid environments.
